name: Anantara Bangkok Riverside Resort & Spa

reviews.text: Decided to stay at the Anantara riverside last weekend, we normally head up to Cha-Am or Hua Hin but as we have their aspire card and had family staying we decided to stay in Bangkok.
reviews.title: A nice weekend getaway from the hustle and bustle

reviews.text: We had 2 nights and 2 rooms, 1 deluxe twin room and 1 anantara suite, the suite was booked for ourselves as it was our anniversary weekend and our daughter and Mother stayed in the twin, my only complaint about the twin is that there is no stand alone shower…(personal pet hate) but the rooms were clean and with good amenities.
reviews.title: Old but Clean,Do Not take city view room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is right on the Chao Praya river and its nice to sit at the long tail bar and watch the world float by of an evening, the staff are very good and always attentive
reviews.title: FANTASTIC Hotel
A Good Choice on the River
reviews.text: I love the pool as it feels like you are totally isolated and there are not many places in Bangkok that you get the feeling of this.
I will certainly be returning some time in the near future!
reviews.title: Truly memorable stay in a wonderfully situated oasis of calm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Anantara (formerly the Marriott) is an oasis of calm and customer centred service. Close to the heart of the great city, its frequent and complimentary ferry to the east side of the river, makes travel very easy, taking you straight to the SkyTrain, and further river ferries, private and public.
reviews.title: An Oasis In The Middle Of Bangkok

reviews.text: The `resort and spa' never forgets that when all is said and done, it's a five star hotel. Its decor, passion for cleanliness and attention to your needs, are obvious from the reception onwards.
reviews.title: A memorable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's pool and generous indoor and outdoor public spaces, more than justify it's claim to be a spa. You are however, never far from a bar, a patisserie, or some other facility, to cater for your whim. These public spaces are all excellently tended and manicured for your comfort and relaxation.
reviews.title: Simply impressive.

reviews.text: Room pricing is very competitive, though slightly less so when breakfast is included in the rate.
reviews.title: Oasis in bangkok

reviews.text: After several long flights into this great city, this hotel has never failed to heal. Highly recommended!!
reviews.title: Community around Bangkok river

reviews.text: I often travel to Bangkok for work and the Anantara is my first choice of stays. I have stayed in other fine, high end hotels and found them to be exceptional, but there's a quiet, peaceful, unpretentious feel to the Anantara that the others cannot touch. The gardens, grounds and architecture are lovely, giving a feeling like you are miles away from the bustle of Bangkok. Its location on the river about a mile and a half south of the main hotel and restaurant region may make it seem a bit distant, but the hotel boat can have you at Saphan Taksin pier in 15 minutes. Plus, the distance adds to the serenity. There's also a new Asiatique shopping district practically across the river. I wish I could give it six starts since it's my favorite place to stay anywhere.
reviews.title: Remains my favorite in Bangkok

reviews.text: Stay her as an alternative to getting out of Bangkok. The place feels like an old colonial beach resort.
reviews.title: Atmosphere plus
Not as good as it was during previous visits and stays.
reviews.text: Excellent pool gym bars and restaurants. I stronly recomend both Brio and Trader Vic's. Cheeper options are available at the adjoining small mall and if you want more choice at Asiatec across the river.
On the down side:
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: You are far from any attractions
reviews.title: Tranquil Hotel in the busy Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our Honeymoon experience was made special by Anantara. Since we were GHA members, we were provided a complimentary upgrade to a suite. The hotel is just fabulous. Loved every bit of it. The rooms, the service, the ambiance was just splendid. The hotel even provided us a honeymoon special cake the next day morning. We were so delighted and made us feel all the more special..Thanks Anantara..
reviews.title: Amazing stay at Anantara...

reviews.text: The only disappointing piece was the buffet dinner which was not upto the mark. It was not really worth the money. May be there can be an improvement in this area.
reviews.title: Only if you want a resort vacation. Inconvenient for shopping.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we have been recommending this hotel to almost all my friends. Thanks again Anantara...you take good care of your guests.
reviews.title: VERY GOOD INDEED!!

reviews.text: Generally this hotel was alright. The good balanced out the bad. Details below.
reviews.title: Stunning hotel resort with great service
Lovely resort on edge of city
reviews.text: Service

reviews.title: Relaxing resort feel
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in Janaury. We arrived late in the evening so we had to contend with Bangkok traffic so by the time we arrived it was a welcome relief. The hotel felt very calm and relaxing and as it is located on the otherside of the river it has a lovely resort feel. A free river shuttle is also provided which is a very enjoyable 15 minute journey to the skytrain station.

We were upgraded to a suite which had an amazingly comfortable bed and we were also lucky enough to have a river view from one of the balcony's. Breakfast was fantastic on our 1st morning with so much choice, however due to an early departure on our 2nd morning we had to settle for the room service breakfast which was dissapointing.
reviews.title: Great Marriott Resort on the River in Bangkok

likes.liked: — Location and design/layout of the hotel and grounds

reviews.text: The hotel spa is expensive even by Bangkok standards so if you fancy a massage Nong Relax's in the shopping centre adjacent to the hotel is great value and very relaxing! The restaurants at the hotel are also very expensive considering you can eat so cheaply in Thailand - we tried Trader Vic's however it was expensive poor quality food!
reviews.title: Definately going again

reviews.text: As this was our 2nd visit to Bangkok the location of the hotel did not bother us. If you are on a first visit for only a couple of days it is possibly not the best location. However we would definately stay here again as it was a welcome oasis after a day in the madness of Bangkok!
reviews.title: Superb, Marvellous, Fantastic!

reviews.text: Our family stayed at this resort after Christmas for 3 nights and had a wonderful experience with the weather between70-80+degrees. The location is perfect-a relaxed atmosphere away from the downtown but comfortably close by the hotel's ferrry- about 15-20 minutes away. The setting is perfect on the river,and the resort is spacious with beautiful gardens, pool, terraced dining, a variety of restaurants on the premises and a small mall across the street. Rooms are well decorated, updated and large-particularly those with a river view and balcony. Would also highly recommend the buffet with the Thai traditional floor show...definitely 4 or 5 star.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in the world?

reviews.text: Our recent stay at the Anantara resort was a thoroughly relaxing experience. The rooms were very clean, beds comfortable, staff were extremely polite. The location was a little far out if you enjoy night markets, but the hotel provided a free shuttle boat every half hour until midnight from downtown Bangkok. Although there is Asiatique nearby which provides more up market lounges & restaurants.
reviews.title: Calm & beauty, a great experience

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was a delight, there is cuisine to suit every taste. We did not try the spa which was a shame as it was a little expensive.
reviews.title: Execellent Retreat in Bustling Bangkok

reviews.text: The gardens beautifully kept, it was a very good experience if you are looking to relax after a full day of running around in Bangkok.
reviews.title: Oh Yes!!!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Anantara Riverside for both business and pleasure, and was very impressed.
reviews.title: Excellent resort

reviews.text: Firstly, the setting of the hotel makes you feel like you're away at a beach destination rather than right in the middle of bustling Bangkok. The landscaping and plentiful flora and foliage provides an ideal relaxed setting.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel! Very!
Very nice hotel
reviews.text: We had a Jr suite for 3 of us at the Marriott Resort for a 4 night stay. Our room was on the 6th floor in one of the side buildings, with a glimpse of the river, a view of the traffic on the bridge and some sort of warehouse building. We did not spend any time on our balcony because it was much too hot.

reviews.title: What a great way to enjoy Bangkok
reviews.text: Our accommodations were quite nice, very comfortable bed and the a/c worked great. My only complaint is the lighting, especially in the bathroom. Could be a bit brighter, but we dealt with it.

reviews.title: a little oasis
reviews.text: Hotel grounds are nice and well maintained. There is a slight smell of the waterway under the bridge between buildings, but we only noticed it during the heat of the day.

reviews.title: Nice hotel but not great.
reviews.text: We found the staff lovely, very nice and helpful. We also did a massage treatment and found the spa very tranquil and the service top knotch.

reviews.title: Great hotel - a little trip from city center
reviews.text: The comfortable Club Lounge had a nice variety of daily appetizers and cocktails, afternoon tea and an ample breakfast buffet. The Riverfront restaurant also had larger breakfast buffet with a wide variety of food choices. In the evening there is a Thai dancing show during buffet dinner on the outdoor patio.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we live about 15 Kilometres away from this hotel in Bangkok and decided to have a two night break here.We tried the Japanese teppanyaki one night and were lucky to get two seats as the place is very popular with the local thais. The restaurant was full .The guy cooking for us put on a bit of a show and had us up there with him balancing and throwing eggs on the end of a spatula, ours shattered his were fine.It was a corny but funny interaction.We booked on the hotel site and they specify which rooms have been renovated.We had a riverview room and it had a spectacular in your face view.I had a massage in the spa and it was very good certainly not as cheap as the street but much better surroundings in the hotel spa. Breakfast was too good for someone like me a overeater.This hotel is not in the same class as say the mandarin oriental across the river or the peninsula but then its not anywhere near as expensive.We would stay again and indeed have booked for 5 nights over new year.
reviews.title: very comfortable and interesting

reviews.text: Good value and relaxing moment in a peacefull tropical garden

reviews.text: I visited the Marriott Resort and Spa in September, 2006 and had the opportunity to return for 4 nights (February 27-March 3). The property is consistently excellent -- fine lodging, dining, service, and facilities.
reviews.title: Better the second time around!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only aspect of this property is its location -- a 15-minute water shuttle ride from the pier where the major activities of the city begin. However, you also get a much quieter location than in the hub of boat and tourist traffic.
reviews.title: really wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an ideal location for somebody seeking peace and quiet in a luxurious location. There are several on-site restaurants, a top notch (Mandara) spa, great pool, and a proficient, courteous, and motivated staff. During my stay I also saw several business meeting rooms being used -- a great place to combine a business meeting and vacation.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, but beware their credit card scam

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this property to anybody visiting Bangkok.
reviews.title: Amazing - and great value!

reviews.text: we were in the marriott hotel in february, we loved it !
reviews.title: Best Riverside Hotel
Faded glory...... but still got what it takes!
reviews.text: We have stayed in this hotel on two occasions before, both of which were when it was a Marriott hotel. The hotel seems a little tired now, and is in need of a little TLC. There is nothing more negative to say than that! And to be honest that is a fact.
However, if you like a calm, oasis of peace away from the hustle and bustle at the same time as wanting quality and service then for me.... go no further than the Anantara Riverside.
reviews.title: Very good service!

reviews.text: What a lovely place. We arrived in BKK with all of our accom booked with the exception of the last night. We had opted to stay for three nights elsewhere in Bangkok for a change, before travelling to Hua Hin. All that remained to book was the last night in Bangkok before flying home.
reviews.title: Resplendent Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed in the Emporium Suites for our first three nights, we opted not to return but to revisit the Riverside due to our previous good experience there. We were not disappointed. It really is a lovely hotel. OK its is not modern. It needs a facelift! However, in my opinion it has a charm and personality of its own. I will definitely return to the Anantara Riverside again as it has a lovely pool, calm and tranquil location, oodles of choice on chill out areas/pool areas/ restaurants, and a stones throw by free courtesy boat to either the Skytrain terminal at Saphan Taksin or the Asiatique night market.
reviews.title: Bangkok Sanctuary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst there, we had lunch by the pool with a friend who works in the City. She met a work colleague by chance at the hotel who stated that he brought his family 4km from the centre of Bangkok to the Anantara Riverside on a regular basis just for the weekend... for some chill out time.... what better reference than that!
reviews.title: A haven of calm and beauty
WATCH OUT! Not all taxis will take you back home....
reviews.text: First off I would like to say we loved this hotel. It is a true 5 star hotel. I stayed there with my husband & 2 children. We had two junior suites with an interconecting door.

reviews.title: loved it but there are some negatives
reviews.text: The major problem we had with this hotel was that because it is over the river and considered 'outside Bangkok', if you are in the city trying to get a taxi back home it becomes very difficult. They dont like to drive over the river and will try and get you to pay ridiculous prices for the trip back home. This lead to some uncomfortable moments with some horrible taxi drivers. You can always get a taxi into the city no problem as the marriot can call them.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel - a perfect base for exploring Bangkok
reviews.text: Another thing to watch out for is if it is raining they cant run the boats which either leaves you with the prospect of not being able to go out or having to go out in a taxi and pray that you can get back in.

reviews.title: Fantastic Stay!
reviews.text: We stayed there for 12 nights so after about the 4th or 5th day having to take the boat to the skytrain then pick up a taxi to eslewhere does become a little draining. So the distance of this hotel is its only drawback.

reviews.title: Wonderful Stay
reviews.text: As mentioned the hotel is awesome. If you would like to do some relaxing as well as sight seeing, this is the hotel for you.

reviews.text: good hotel-nice location on the riverside. average rooms, nice restaurants- but very bad service! it all started that we had to wait in our room for exactly 1 hour for our luggage when we arrived. service in the hotelrestaurant - traders vic - was incredable bad. long waiting times, wrong dishes- very slow and bad. the riverside restaurant restaurant with excellent buffet -big selection. service not eductated, bad wine selection-white wine warm....not really to recommand for a longer stay
reviews.title: Time for a change
Wonderful hotel!
reviews.text: This hotel is wonderful, we loved it! Possibly the our favourite hotel that we have stayed in around the world. The people are very friendly and helpful. The rooms, we had junior suites, were brilliant, really nice, fresh fruit and beautiful flowers every day, in fact flowers appeared more than once a day! The restaurants are excellent, a lovely one overlooking the river, good food and entertainment - thai 'fingernail dancing' and local dances. Breakfast was varied choice and in nice area. The gardens of the hotel are really nice and it has a lovely pool, with a swim up bar. Also a gym if you are feeling energetic! The hotel has a boat that runs free of charge across the river where you can get to other parts of the city. Not perhaps the most central hotel but definitely has to be the best!

reviews.title: "Absolutely Wonderful"
reviews.text: We’ve recently returned from 5 nights here and I can honestly say this is the best hotel in the world that we’ve stayed in. All the staff were wonderful – friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. We accepted the upgrade to a river view room for approx £15 per night, which we thought was worth it. The buffet breakfast was extensive, catering for every nationality and taste and the Numero Uno take away bakery was very handy for something during the day. We ate in one of the restaurants every night but the shopping arcade across the road, has KFC, McDonalds and other eating places if you want something cheaper or have children. The free shuttle boat to the centre runs every 15 minutes and the cold towel and water on the return trip were much appreciated. However, I did use the massage in the arcade as it was considerably cheaper than the spa in the hotel. We didn't have any problem using our credit card and iIt would be worth the 11 hour flight just to go back for a couple of days!

reviews.title: Suburban Oasis
reviews.text: Beautiful property. The grounds are especially well cared for. Very tropical, resort feel to the entire place. We really didn't feel like we were staying in the city, felt more like the type of property you'd find at the beach.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: As mentioned in many of the reviews, the hotel is a bit further outside the city than most others. An easy 15 minute shuttle boat takes you to Sathorn pier and the Skytrain station is right there. And the cold towels and water are definitely a treat when you're coming back from a day or night on the town.

reviews.title: Beautiful property, incredible staff
reviews.text: The rooms were nice, a bit spartan, but comfortable. Bathroom was on the small side, but nice touches that included marble vanities and teak.

reviews.title: Verdant oasis
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 days from Jan 12th -15th 2007. This is a verdant oasis in the steamy heat of Bangkok, on the river so ideally situated for taking cheap and frequent public ferries up and down the river to the temples and grand palace. Marriott runs a service over to the ferries and skytrain every 15 mins - free water and cold towels too. This is a 5* hotel which offers all mod cons as you might expect, with a large and deep pool set in interesting gardens, and only 6 floors high. Several restaurants on site generally v. good with excellent, friendly numerous staff, and immaculate service. Cost us £97 per night b and b. Meals varied from £10 to £30 so expensive by Thai standards but good quality. The new airport is on the other side of town, but the new urban motorway kept us free of jams. Meter taxi from the hotel to airport is only £9, but beware the £25 limo monopoly from airport to hotel. My guess is that the meter taxis are not given access to the arrival terminal. Avoid £55 massage - you can get an hour at Wat Pho Temple school for only £5. Clifford Gould, England.

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.text: Amazing hotel. So comfortable and welcoming.
It is well worth the extra ferry trip down river to stay at this hotel as it is an oasis of calm in an otherwise hectic city.
reviews.title: one of the best hotels

description: Tropical Serenity In An Urban OasisSet on the banks of the grand Chao Phraya River, Anantara Bangkok Riverside Resort & Spa is a thriving oasis offering a unique way to experience the City of Angels. Majestic palms swaying in the breeze. Spa treatments hidden within lush tropical gardens. Luxurious suites lit by the twinkle of the city skyline. Delectable meals fusing tastes from around the globe.Situated on 11 riverside acres of verdant gardens, Anantara Bangkok Riverside Resort & Spa seamlessly blends the thrill of urban living with the serene charms of tropical luxury. Imparted with Thai tradition and legendary Anantara service, this exotic Bangkok resort offers a respite from the hustle and bustle of the busy metropolis. Take in the sunset from the edge of the pier, watching as river life unfolds before your eyes. Indulge in pampering spa treatments set in the tranquil environment of your own private garden. Enjoy unforgettable meals at any of our 10 bars or restaurants, each offering individual delicacies. Embrace the unique harmony of luxury and nature within this stunning Bangkok resort & spa.
